newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan money rates close slightly up on NCD issue.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan money rates close slightly up on NCD issue.

text.p: Taiwan's money rates finished slightly higher on Monday as the central bank's issue of T$5 billion negotiable certificates of deposit tightened liquidity, dealers said.

The overnight interbank rate ended at 5.921 percent against Saturday's 5.838 close -- somewhat outside the central bank's target zone of 5.00-5.5 percent -- with 30-day commercial paper up to 5.80 percent against 5.70-5.75.

Dealers said liquidity in the banking system would remain relatively loose in the near term as some T$13 billion worth of NCDs were due to mature later in the week and funds that flowed out of the banking system were gradually returning.
The central bank is expected to issue more NCDs to mop up funds, they added.

In the bond market, the benchmark 10-year 86/4 bond yield fell to a three-month low in earlier session. Dealers said the government bond market likely would attract more interest after Monday's dramatic 3.72 percent stock-market plunge.
